page.title: 09Local History
page.content: They put drains and dykes there to take water away to the river. A land drain is a pipe that runs underground in a field and goes to a dyke which will then run to a river. There is a house drain which runs into the sewers which gets treated and goes to a dyke and runs to the river. In the house drain it runs to the manhole , then to the sewers. The land drains start about eighteen inches under the ground to take the surface water and go into the dyke about three feet under the ground. The main job of a drain is to take all the rain water and waste water to the dyke.
